C044AA69713E488A9738660423EFC080.description: Demonstrate how to prevent and respond to work-related accidents or injuries; this includes demonstrating an understanding of ergonomics.

70C7D22DD79B4B28BB650BCCE8434A03.description: Practice personal safety when lifting, bending, or moving equipment and supplies.

6D54874980E04DAF9ED5C004D10DEE0B.description: Use health and safety practices for storing, cleaning, and maintaining tools, equipment, and supplies.

9A0D3988682A4E2D9108D4149939209A.description: Interpret policies, procedures, and regulations for the workplace environment, including employer and employee responsibilities.

4300132241A74621B1DCCCDB3415B49E.description: Locate, and adhere to, Material Safety Data Sheet (MSDS) instructions.

comments: Demonstrate health and safety procedures, regulations, and personal health practices and determine the meaning of symbols, key terms, and domain-specific words and phrases as related to the Transportation sector workplace environment.

DDDCF79FAA0D431D99FDC960F491AC7A.description: Interpret information and draw conclusions, based on the best analysis, to make informed decisions.

FF53BDCADBC94EC39EF77521BC11A373.description: Use systems thinking to analyze how various components interact with each other to produce outcomes in a complex work environment.

4231C0094A964CCDAF8C58E75A7FDDFE.description: Solve predictable and unpredictable work-related problems using various types of reasoning (inductive, deductive) as appropriate.

3C904DE4CD5647AEA8D3107C79F2E78B.description: Identify and ask significant questions that clarify various points of view to solve problems.

comments: Conduct short, as well as more sustained, research to create alternative solutions to answer a question or solve a problem unique to the Transportation sector using critical and creative thinking, logical reasoning, analysis, inquiry, and problem-solving techniques.

80815B5709B84FC491277C22D7996F44.description: Assess the value of various information and communication technologies to interact with constituent populations as part of a search of the current literature or in relation to the information task.

A27A3FD1139E46BCBE285D6CE1EE4FDD.description: Research past, present, and projected technological advances as they impact a particular pathway.

D44BF4DD85504369AAC77977F5D5C885.description: Discern the quality and value of information collected using digital technologies, and recognize bias and intent of the associated sources.

6C07D765984A4334BDB43149BC17B519.description: Use information and communication technologies to synthesize, summarize, compare, and contrast information from multiple sources.

5CA026595EC44CBBAB63AB281FFAFD90.description: Employ Web-based communications responsibly and effectively to explore complex systems and issues.

CDB2CE4D5E4940B7952AA882AF17E99B.description: Use electronic reference materials to gather information and produce products and services.

comments: Use existing and emerging technology to investigate, research, and produce products and services, including new information, as required in the Transportation sector workplace environment.

FC36A6C640D546FC8FE414C5077C8A6F.description: Develop a career plan that reflects career interests, pathways, and postsecondary options.

26756839C2D64299B959FE6F59C409D6.description: Understand how digital media are used by potential employers and postsecondary agencies to evaluate candidates.

FADDA576DA9848BC95BD08A4A4E0349E.description: Recognize the importance of small business in the California and global economies.

7D2FE28F30C04E858EBF6A354BFE5B57.description: Recognize the role and function of professional organizations, industry associations, and organized labor in a productive society.

139C5D5F4DB0466CBE1E7E742A0E03EA.description: Integrate changing employment trends, societal needs, and economic conditions into career planning.

56ECA45811BA4B6A8176835558965404.description: Research the scope of career opportunities available and the requirements for education, training, certification, and licensure.

2E912880B585400584C242D2EACCF47B.description: Explore how information and communication technologies are used in career planning and decision making.

747A61742B524493A778EDAADF93A77B.description: Evaluate personal character traits such as trust, respect, and responsibility and understand the impact they can have on career success.

120FE9DF108948DD85C95F85C29CDC63.description: Identify personal interests, aptitudes, information, and skills necessary for informed career decision making.

comments: Integrate multiple sources of career information from diverse formats to make informed career decisions, solve problems, and manage personal career plans.

4365E23B027D45E1AC05DC229C746C1F.description: Advocate and practice safe, legal, and responsible use of digital media information and communications technologies.

D7EBC552D5E94A24BF78AAD2F621580F.description: Communicate information and ideas effectively to multiple audiences using a variety of media and formats.

EB2846B47ECF40039028E9E2897DDC34.description: Demonstrate elements of written and electronic communication such as accurate spelling, grammar, and format.

BFD18BC4484A447E9A3F9AAC9783D2C7.description: Interpret verbal and nonverbal communications and respond appropriately.

CB202667B73D45A3944990E829A0E844.description: Identify barriers to accurate and appropriate communication.

3697F0B956BE46EB8D6904CC6703D918.description: Recognize the elements of communication using a sender–receiver model.

comments: Acquire and accurately use Transportation sector terminology and protocols at the career and college readiness level for communicating effectively in oral, written, and multimedia formats.

Analyze and apply appropriate academic standards required for successful industry sector pathway completion leading to postsecondary education and employment. Refer to the Transportation academic alignment matrix for identification of standards.
